title: Bonds & Betrayals
description: Test your knowledge of the complex relationships in Arcane!

questions.question: What is the relationship between Vi and Jinx?
questions.explanation: Vi and Jinx (Powder) are sisters. Their tragic separation and complicated bond is the emotional core of the entire series.

questions.question: Vi and Caitlyn develop a romantic relationship in the series.
questions.explanation: Vi and Caitlyn's relationship develops from reluctant allies to romantic partners throughout the series, culminating in a kiss in Season 1.

questions.question: Why did Powder accidentally cause tragedy in episode 3?

options.text: Her homemade bomb worked for the first time

questions.explanation: Powder wanted to help save Vander. Her hextech-powered monkey bomb finally worked, but exploded inside the building, killing Mylo and Claggor.

questions.question: Who does Silco view as his daughter?
questions.explanation: Silco adopts Jinx after finding her abandoned and raises her as his own daughter, genuinely loving her despite his villainous nature.

questions.question: Mel Medarda and Jayce become romantically involved.
questions.explanation: Mel and Jayce develop a romantic relationship as she mentors him in politics and he rises to power on the Council.

questions.question: What did Vander do to Silco that destroyed their brotherhood?
questions.explanation: When Vander decided to make peace with Piltover, Silco opposed him. Vander tried to drown Silco to silence him, leaving him scarred and bitter.

questions.question: Who were Mylo and Claggor to Vi and Powder?

options.text: Strangers they met on a heist

questions.explanation: Mylo and Claggor were orphans like Vi and Powder, all raised together by Vander as a found family in The Last Drop.

questions.question: What happens to Viktor's assistant Sky?

options.text: She is absorbed by the Hexcore

questions.explanation: Sky, who had romantic feelings for Viktor, is tragically absorbed and killed by the Hexcore when she tries to help him during an experiment.
